project.teaser: The aim of BIOLOC is to advance the role and impact of biobased and social innovation to revitalise European local communities to accelerate the all-inclusive transition to a resource-efficient and circular biobased production and consumption system. BIOLOC will blend...
project.objective: The aim of BIOLOC is to advance the role and impact of biobased and social innovation to revitalise European local communities to accelerate the all-inclusive transition to a resource-efficient and circular biobased production and consumption system. BIOLOC will blend methodological work with circumstantial actions focused in 12 European regions (IT, NL, ES, DE, GR, BG, SK, SL, HR, HU, RO, CZ) that have been selected based on their circular biobased economy (CBE) deployment potentials. BIOLOC identified the following specific objectives as most urgent and attainable through an envisaged set of CSA-actions: i) to raise awareness; ii) to revitalise local economies; iii) to advance inclusive business models; iv) to increase opportunities; v) to valorise knowledge and enhance capacities, and vi) to sustain innovation ecosystems. BIOLOC will address these non-technical challenges from the perspective of local development to elaborate on concepts and solutions that will favour a positive cascading effect on communities by fostering a participatory and inclusive approach to developing resilient innovative biobased activities open to the contribution of socially disadvantaged or marginalized groups. BIOLOC will prompt and drive the establishment of permanent public-private multi-stakeholder communities-of-practice/deployment HUBS that will pioneer social trialogue on an innovative and inclusive CBE as a leveraging factor for sustainable and resilient local development in the broader context of the New Green Deal. The extensive awareness-raising and outreach activities that will address the wider population, including the socially disadvantaged/ marginalized groups, will allow bringing an ancillary contribution to the expected impact of more informed and engaged stakeholders and end-users, including primary producers and consumers.
project.title: Biobased and social innovation to revitalise European local communities
project.keywords: biobased innovation, social innovation, revitalisation European local communities

article.title: Creating a participatory and inclusive approach

result.title: D5.2 - Map of local stakeholder needs, drivers and barriers
result.description: This report will summarise the information that BIOLOC will gather through live interaction with stakeholders in participating regions to map local actors and highlight barriers, needs and drivers for participatory and sustainable CBE. This information will form the background and starting point for further elaboration within BIOLOC Hubs.

result.title: D1.1 - Project Management and Quality Plan
result.description: This report will facilitate the day-by-day implementation and monitoring of project activities, serving also as a concise guideline for PPs.

result.title: D1.3 - Exploitation Plan
result.description: This report will provide guidance to PPs regarding exploitation activities. Based on the experience accrued during project implementation, it will be updated on M36

result.title: D2.1 - Report on the analysis of the variety of bio-economies in participating local communities
result.description: This report will reckon the heterogeneity of bioeconomy across EU regions and investigate the correlations with local development and innovation trends to extrapolate knowledge and recommendations for BIOLOC activities in participating regions.

result.title: D1.5 - Data Management Plan - DMP
result.description: This report will provide guidance to PPs as regards data management standards and procedures to be implemented in the framework of BIOLOC. Based on the experience accrued during project implementation, the report will be updated on M 18 and M36.

result.title: D4.1 - Analysis of local context
result.description: This report will assess the state-of-the-art in participating regions as per current socio-economic activities, bio-based value chains, productive districts, specialisations, strengths and pain points. This will serve as the baseline for developing innovative business models and leveraging local stakeholders commitment.

result.title: D4.2 - Opportunities for local value chains
result.description: This report will highlight the most promising existing or prospective local CBE value chains and thus trigger action in participating regions for their valorisation, including developing innovative business models implemented by BIOLOC.

result.title: D3.2 - Catalogue based on the established framework of concepts
result.description: This report will allow identifying relevant green and inclusive regional innovation projects and small-scale solutions with a balanced economic, environmental and social perspective.

result.title: D2.2 - Report on the Regional biobased systems cases description
result.description: This report will provide a comprehensive description of participating regions from the point of view of relevant CBE systems to set the ground for the elaboration of tailored support.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - BIOLOC (Biobased and social innovation to revitalise European local communities)
result.teaser: BIOLOC recognises the unique value of local knowledge and its contribution to the circular bioeconomy. Despite the disruptive nature of these technologies, their adoption often mirrors traditional industry deployment patterns. While this replication has organisational...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: D1.2 - Dissemination and Communication Plan
result.description: This report will provide concise guidance to PPs on all aspects related to communication and dissemination activities. Based on the experience accrued during the implementation, the report will be updated on M18.

result.title: D3.1 - Factsheet template
result.description: This report will allow building a standardized framework to describe local CBE systems to select appropriate environmental and social innovation concepts and solutions.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
